trans-unit.source: Refers to the density of a typeface, in terms of the lightness or heaviness of the strokes.

Weight differences are generally differentiated by an increased stroke or thickness that is associated with a given character in a typeface, as compared to a "normal" character from that same typeface.
**Note** Not all weights are available for all typefaces.
When a weight is not available for a typeface, the closest matching weight is returned.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *fontWeightsValue* A property name, such as "Light", "Normal", or "UltraBold".
Compares two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref>.
Lighter font weights are lesser than heavier font weights.
For example, a "Light" or "Normal" font weight is lesser than an "UltraBold" font weight.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> object to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> object to compare.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that indicates the relationship between the two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref>.
When the return value is less than zero, left is less than right.
When this value is zero, it indicates that both operands are equal.
When the value is greater than zero, it indicates that left is greater than right.
Determines whether the current <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> object is equal to a specified object.
The <xref:System.Object> to compare for equality.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the two instances are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the current <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> object is equal to a specified <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> object.
The instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare for equality.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the two instances are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> that corresponds to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_opentype](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-opentype-md.md)] `usWeightClass` value.

For more information about the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_opentype](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-opentype-md.md)] `usWeightClass` value , see the ["Font File Tables"](http://www.microsoft.com/typography/otspec/otff.htm) section of the OpenType specification.
An integer value between 1 and 999 that corresponds to the `usWeightClass` definition in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_opentype](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] specification.
A new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref>.
Retrieves the hash code for this object.
The returned value serves as a hash function for a particular type, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
A 32-bit hash code, which is a signed integer.
Compares two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> for equality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Evaluates two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to determine whether one instance is greater than the other.
Lighter font weights are lesser than heavier font weights.
For example, a "Light" or "Normal" font weight is lesser than an "UltraBold" font weight.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
if left is greater than right; otherwise, .
Evaluates two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to determine whether one instance is greater than or equal to the other.
Lighter font weights are lesser than heavier font weights.
For example, a "Light" or "Normal" font weight is lesser than an "UltraBold" font weight.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
if left is greater than or equal to right; otherwise, .
Evaluates two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to determine inequality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
if left is equal to right; otherwise, .
Evaluates two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to determine whether one instance is less than the other.
Lighter font weights are lesser than heavier font weights.
For example, a "Light" or "Normal" font weight is lesser than an "UltraBold" font weight.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
if left is less than right; otherwise, .
Evaluates two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to determine whether one instance is less than or equal to the other.
Lighter font weights are lesser than heavier font weights.
For example, a "Light" or "Normal" font weight is lesser than an "UltraBold" font weight.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> to compare.
if left is less than or equal to right; otherwise, .
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.IFormattable.ToString%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref:System.String> specifying the format to use.
-or- <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref:System.IFormattable> implementation.
The <xref:System.IFormatProvider> to use to format the value.
-or- <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
A <xref:System.String> containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.
Returns a value that represents the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_opentype](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-opentype-md.md)] `usWeightClass` for the <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> object.

For more information about the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_opentype](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-opentype-md.md)] `usWeightClass` value, see the ["Font File Tables"](http://www.microsoft.com/typography/otspec/otff.htm) section of the OpenType specification.
An integer value between 1 and 999 that corresponds to the `usWeightClass` definition in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_opentype](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] specification.

Returns a text string that represents the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> object and is based on the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture*> property information.
A <xref:System.String> that represents the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeight"></xref> object, such as "Light", "Normal", or "UltraBold".
